meanings.definition: To cheat or deceive someone in order to get money or something else of value.
meanings.sent1: The con artist tried to swindle the old lady out of her life savings.
meanings.sent2: It is wrong to swindle people out of their hard-earned money.
meanings.sent3: The magician joked that he would swindle the audience out of their disbelief.
meanings.sent4: The dishonest salesman managed to swindle his way into the customer's trust.
meanings.sent5: The cunning fox used its charm to swindle the other animals out of their food.

meanings.sent1: The Ponzi scheme turned out to be a massive swindle, leaving many people penniless.
meanings.sent2: The elaborate swindle involved fake identities and forged documents.
meanings.sent3: The comedy movie featured a hilarious plot centered around a ridiculous swindle.
meanings.sent4: The scandal exposed a political swindle that shocked the entire nation.
meanings.sent5: The art heist was a daring swindle that baffled even the most experienced detectives.
